subject: Re: [junit] [OT] coverage plugins for eclipse?
msgSnippet: ... Playing devil s advocate to some extent here, I m surprised at this. I read your developerworks article about cobertura, but you ve made some reasonably
messageBody:
On 02/09/05, Elliotte Harold <elharo@...> wrote:
>
> Thomas L Roche wrote:
>
> > I'm wondering, what are folks who use Eclipse (or Eclipse-based
> > products) using to do coverage measurement and reporting? One option
> > is to just run the coverage tool from the command line or ant, but I'd
> > really like something more integrated, e.g.
>
>
> The only other option I know is Cobertura. There's no official plugin,
> but the build file can make one. Whether it works or not, I don't know.
> It could probably be made to work with a little hacking.
>
> http://cobertura.sourceforge.net/
>
> --
> Elliotte Rusty Harold elharo@...
> XML in a Nutshell 3rd Edition Just Published!
> http://www.cafeconleche.org/books/xian3/
> http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ISBN=0596007647/cafeaulaitA/ref=nosim
>
>
Playing devil's advocate to some extent here, I'm surprised at this. I read
your developerworks article about cobertura, but you've made some reasonably
dogmatic statements on this list about deleting any code that doesn't have a
test (which I personally have found have made me a lot more positive in
overcoming my FearOfDeletingCode (need to add a c2 wiki entry about that)
(too many nested parentheses in that sentence - must stop posting after
drinking champagne) . By induction, why do you need a code coverage tool?

James


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
